name: CheckIn
text message: Hi! Have you been able to create a daily routine with your child these past few days?

name: CheckIn
text message: Hi! Have you been able to give your teen any responsibilities during the last week?

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: That's okay. It can be hard sometimes to remember. Next time you have a task that your teen could do, you can give the job to them. Children often respond well when they are given the opportunity to become more responsible. Praise your teen whenever they complete their job, you can say “thank you for doing such a great job!”.

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry, I don't understand what you mean.

name: CheckIn
text message: Well done! As your teen shows more responsibility, you can also give them extra privileges. Try to share responsibilities equally amongst women/men and girls/boys. Praise your teen whenever they do their job!

name: CheckIn
text message: Well done, you are doing a great job! Having regular routines allows your children to feel safe and secure. Remember that it is important to schedule free time for your child (and for you!). Keep it up!

name: CheckIn
text message: It can be hard sometime to remember. Routines help your children feel safe and secure. Try to have regular mealtimes and bedtimes. Remember to schedule One-on-One time with your children, too!

text message: Would you like to review the content?

name: CheckIn
text message: That is okay! Remember you can access parenting content at anytime by typing "Help". Chat to you later!
